message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
```java
package randomintegers;
import java.util.*;
import java.io.*;

public class RandomIntegers {
    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {
        int randomNumbers[] = new int [1000];
        for (int i=0; i<randomNumbers.length; ++i){
            randomNumbers[i] = 1 + (int)(Math.random() * 10);
        }
        int[] frequency = calcFrequency(randomNumbers);
        double average = calcAverage(randomNumbers);
        writeToFile(frequency, average);
    }

    public static int[] calcFrequency(int[] inputArray){
        int[] freq=new int[10];
        for (int i=0; i<inputArray.length; ++i){
            ++freq[inputArray[i]-1];
        }
        return freq;
    }

    public static double calcAverage(int[] randomNumbers) {
        int sum = 0;
        for(int i : randomNumbers) sum += i;
        return ((double) sum)/randomNumbers.length;
    }

    public static void writeToFile(int[] frequency, double average) throws IOException {
        PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(new File("randomIntegers.txt"));
        writer.write("Frequency: " + Arrays.toString(frequency) + "\n");
        writer.write("Average: " + average + "\n");
        writer.close();
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The PrintWriter.write API is used to write text to a file. In the provided code, a new method called writeToFile is created. This method takes two parameters: an array of integers (frequency) and a double (average). The PrintWriter is initialized with the file "randomIntegers.txt". The frequency array is converted to a string and written to the file, followed by the average. After writing, the PrintWriter is closed to free up resources. The calcFrequency and calcAverage methods are modified to return their results, which are then passed to the writeToFile method.
